org.rdkit.knime.util

Class InputDataInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.InputDataInfo

  • public class InputDataInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Makes information available for easy access of input data required for node execution. It is also used to perform validity and compatibility checks. As the information covered in this object is dynamic, this object should be short living and created when it is needed, e.g. for execution.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
      This exception is thrown, when an empty cell was encountered during processing, which had an Empty Cell Policy DeliverEmptyValue or StopExecution assigned.
      static class  InputDataInfo.EmptyCellPolicy
      This enumeration defines policies for handling of empty cells when the value of a cell is requested from an InputDataInfo object.

      Creates a new input data info object based on a concrete table spec, a column name within a setting model object as well as a data value class that specifies the expected type of value.

      Creates a new input data info object based on a concrete table spec, a column name within a setting model object as well as a data value class that specifies the expected type of value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputDataInfo

        public InputDataInfo(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                     SettingsModelString modelColumnName)
              throws InvalidSettingsException
        Creates a new input data info object based on a concrete table spec and a column name within a setting model object. As empty cell policy TreatAsNull is assigned.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - Table specification. Can be null to throw an InvalidSettingsException.
        modelColumnName - Column model, which act as container for the column name and afterwards as unique id to distinguish between different data info objects. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if something is not set.

      • InputDataInfo

        @SafeVarargs
public InputDataInfo(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                   SettingsModelString modelColumnName,
                                   InputDataInfo.EmptyCellPolicy emptyCellPolicy,
                                   DataCell defaultCell,
                                   java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>... arrDataValueClasses)
                            throws InvalidSettingsException
        Creates a new input data info object based on a concrete table spec, a column name within a setting model object as well as a data value class that specifies the expected type of value. There are several checks performed to ensure that data are compatible with the processing that will happen later. The most important information that is delivered is the index of the column within the specified table. This must be easily accessible during processing.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - Table specification. Can be null to throw an InvalidSettingsException.
        modelColumnName - Column model, which act as container for the column name and afterwards as unique id to distinguish between different data info objects. Must not be null.
        emptyCellPolicy - Defines the policy to be used when an empty cell is encountered during processing.
        defaultCell - A default cell value, which can be used when an empty cell is encountered during processing. Can be null.
        arrDataValueClasses - A list of acceptable data types. Optional. If specified, then one needs to be at least compatible with the column spec, otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if something is not set or not compatible with the data types that are expected.

      • InputDataInfo

        @SafeVarargs
public InputDataInfo(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                   java.lang.String strTableDescription,
                                   SettingsModelString modelColumnName,
                                   java.lang.String strColumnDescription,
                                   InputDataInfo.EmptyCellPolicy emptyCellPolicy,
                                   DataCell defaultCell,
                                   java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>... arrDataValueClasses)
                            throws InvalidSettingsException
        Creates a new input data info object based on a concrete table spec, a column name within a setting model object as well as a data value class that specifies the expected type of value. There are several checks performed to ensure that data are compatible with the processing that will happen later. The most important information that is delivered is the index of the column within the specified table. This must be easily accessible during processing.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - Table specification. Can be null to throw an InvalidSettingsException.
        strTableDescription - Optional table description to be used in error message that concern the table. Can be null or empty to show "input table" in messages. Otherwise it will show "strTableDescription table" in messages.
        modelColumnName - Column model, which act as container for the column name and afterwards as unique id to distinguish between different data info objects. Must not be null.
        strColumnDescription - Optional column description to be used in error message that concern the column. Can be null or empty to show "input column" in messages. Otherwise it will show "strColumnDescription column" in messages.
        emptyCellPolicy - Defines the policy to be used when an empty cell is encountered during processing.
        defaultCell - A default cell value, which can be used when an empty cell is encountered during processing. Can be null.
        arrDataValueClasses - A list of acceptable data types. Optional. If specified, then one needs to be at least compatible with the column spec, otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if something is not set or not compatible with the data types that are expected.

      • getModel

        public SettingsModelString getModel()
        Returns the model with the column name.
        Returns:
        Model with the column name.

      • isRowKey

        public boolean isRowKey()
        Determines, if this input column information is representing a row key column.
        Returns:
        True, if this is a row key. False otherwise.

      • getColumnIndex

        public int getColumnIndex()
        Returns a valid index to the column in the input table.
        Returns:
        Column index. -1, if this is a row key column.

      • getColumnSpec

        public DataColumnSpec getColumnSpec()
        Returns the valid column specification of the column in the input table.
        Returns:
        Column specification. Null, if this is a row key column.

      • getColumnDescription

        public java.lang.String getColumnDescription()
        Returns the optional column description.
        Returns:
        Column description, e.g. "molecule" or "atom list". Can be null or empty.

      • getTableSpec

        public DataTableSpec getTableSpec()
        Returns the valid table specification of the table the column belongs to.
        Returns:
        Table specification.

      • getTableDescription

        public java.lang.String getTableDescription()
        Returns the optional table description.
        Returns:
        Table description, e.g. "first" or "molecule". Can be null or empty.

      • getDataType

        public DataType getDataType()
        Returns the valid data type of the column in the input table.
        Returns:
        Column data type. StringCell.TYPE, if this is a row key column.

      • needsConversion

        public boolean needsConversion()
        Returns true, if the input data column is not matching any of the preferred data values, but is convertible using an adapter cell.
        Returns:
        True, if conversion is necessary to use this column. False otherwise.

      • getConverter

        public DataCellTypeConverter getConverter()
        Returns the converter that can be used to convert the input column into an Adapter Cell column to make it compatible with the desired types.
        Returns:
        Data cell type converter or null, if not available.

      • getEmptyCellPolicy

        public InputDataInfo.EmptyCellPolicy getEmptyCellPolicy()
        Returns the configured policy id to be applied when empty cells are encountered.
        Returns:
        The empty cell policy.

      • getDefaultCell

        public DataCell getDefaultCell()
        Returns the default cell value that shall be used, if an empty cell is encountered and the Empty Cell Policy (getEmptyCellPolicy()) is set to InputDataInfo.EmptyCellPolicy.UseDefault.
        Returns:
        Default cell.

      • getOriginalCell

        public DataCell getOriginalCell(DataRow row)
        Determines the cell of the passed in row that is specified by this input data info object. It returns the cell as is without converting it into a datatype. Empty cell policy is not applied when calling this method. This means an empty cell can be returned, which may contain an error message from auto-conversion.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The original cell.

      • getCell

        public DataCell getCell(DataRow row)
                 throws InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
        Determines the cell of the passed in row that is specified by this input data info object. When an empty cell is encountered, it applies the defined empty cell policy. An explicit type check is not performed anymore at this point, because it was done already when this input data info object was created.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The correct cell. The active empty cell policy has been applied before the cell gets returned. If the policy is set to TreatAsNull it will return null, if it is set to UseDefault the configured default cell is returned. If a Custom policy is defined it will return the MissingDataCell in this case and it is up to the caller to handle it properly.
        Throws:
        InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException - Thrown, if an empty cell is encountered and the empty cell policy is set to either DeliverEmptyValue or StopExecution.

      • isMissing

        public boolean isMissing(DataRow row)
        Determines, if the cell of the passed in row that is specified by this input data info object, is a missing cell. This method does not apply any empty cell policy. If this is desired, please call getCell(DataRow) instead and do the comparison manually.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        True, if the cell is missing, false otherwise.

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass)
        Convenience method to check, if the column is compatible with the specified value class. It does not look at a particular cell, but at the column specification. For performance reasons we cache the result. The method takes the isCompatible() information for the cell's datatype into account. It basically determines, if a cell can be cast to the valueClass.
        Parameters:
        valueClass - Value class for compatibility check. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if column type is compatible with specified value class. False otherwise. Also false, if null was passed in.

      • isCompatibleOrAdaptable

        public boolean isCompatibleOrAdaptable(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass)
        Convenience method to check, if the column is compatible with the specified value class. It does not look at a particular cell, but at the column specification. For performance reasons we cache the result. The method takes the isCompatible() and isAdaptable() information for the cell's datatype into account, so it works with normal cells as well as with adapter cells.
        Parameters:
        valueClass - Value class for compatibility check. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if column type is compatible with specified value class. False otherwise. Also false, if null was passed in.

      • isDefault

        public boolean isDefault(DataRow row)
        Determines, if the cell of the passed in row that is specified by this input data info object, is matching the default cell. This method does not apply any empty cell policy. If this is desired, please call getCell(DataRow) instead and do the comparison manually.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        True, if the cell is matching the configured default cell, false otherwise.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(DataRow row)
                           throws InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
        Convenience method that converts the result of getCell(DataRow) into a string.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The string value of the correct cell.
        Throws:
        InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException - See getCell(DataRow).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the cell is not compatible with the StringCell. This is usually an implementation error.
        See Also:
        getCell(DataRow)

      • getIntegerList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getIntegerList(DataRow row)
                                                 throws InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
        Convenience method that converts the result of getCell(DataRow) into an integer list. If the cell contains a collection, but some of the values are not compatible with an integer or double (which will be casted to int), these values will be ignored and a warning is logged.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The integer list contained in the correct cell.
        Throws:
        InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException - See getCell(DataRow).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the cell is not compatible with the collection type. This is usually an implementation error.
        See Also:
        getCell(DataRow)

      • getRDKitIntegerVector

        public Int_Vect getRDKitIntegerVector(DataRow row)
                               throws InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
        Convenience method that converts the result of getCell(DataRow) into an RDKit Int_Vect object. If the cell contains a collection, but some of the values are not compatible with an integer, these values will be ignored and a warning is logged.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The Int_Vect list based on the correct cell.
        Throws:
        InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException - See getCell(DataRow).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the cell is not compatible with the collection type. This is usually an implementation error.
        See Also:
        getCell(DataRow)

      • getRDKitUIntegerVector

        public UInt_Vect getRDKitUIntegerVector(DataRow row)
                                 throws InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException
        Convenience method that converts the result of getCell(DataRow) into an RDKit Int_Vect object. If the cell contains a collection, but some of the values are not compatible with an integer, these values will be ignored and a warning is logged.
        Parameters:
        row - The data row with concrete data cells. This data row must belong to the table, which spec was used in the constructor. Otherwise the behavior is undefined and will probably cause an undefined Exception. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The UInt_Vect list based on the correct cell.
        Throws:
        InputDataInfo.EmptyCellException - See getCell(DataRow).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the cell is not compatible with the collection type. This is usually an implementation error.
        See Also:
        getCell(DataRow)

      • getTableIdentification

        protected java.lang.String getTableIdentification()
        Returns based on the table description passed in to the constructor a short table info. If no table description is defined, it returns "input table", otherwise "columndescription input table".
        Returns:
        Table identification. Never null.

      • getColumnIdentification

        protected java.lang.String getColumnIdentification()
        Returns based on the column description passed in to the constructor a short table info. If no column description is defined, it returns "input column", otherwise "columndescription input column".
        Returns:
        Table identification. Never null.
